meanings.definition: To be in a state of chaos or confusion.
meanings.sent1: The party was snafued by the unexpected rainstorm.
meanings.sent2: I snafued my room trying to find my lost keys.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick snafued when the rabbit escaped from the hat.
meanings.sent4: Her plan to surprise her friend snafued when she accidentally revealed the secret.
meanings.sent5: The classroom was snafued with excitement on the last day of school.

meanings.definition: To mess up or make a mistake.
meanings.sent1: I snafued the recipe by adding too much salt.
meanings.sent2: He snafued his presentation by forgetting his notes.
meanings.sent3: The chef snafued the dish by burning it in the oven.
meanings.sent4: She snafued her chance to apologize by saying the wrong thing.
meanings.sent5: The player snafued the winning shot by missing the basket.

meanings.definition: A situation that has gone wrong or become a mess.
meanings.sent1: The project turned into a snafued mess due to miscommunication.
meanings.sent2: The party was a complete snafued disaster.
meanings.sent3: The family vacation became a snafued comedy of errors.
meanings.sent4: The meeting turned into a snafued circus with everyone talking at once.
meanings.sent5: The play rehearsal was a snafued chaos with actors forgetting their lines.
